sentences.text: I've got Manoj with me who's going to be the onboarding and implementation manager on the call today.
I've given him the entire use case that we're going to be looking at sales at the rate and box management, and that would be amongst a couple of folks in the team today.

We are doing so much manual tasks in outlook and we needed to have a better solution to manage the transparency visibility on these tickets, ownership on these emails, replying back to these emails and everything in a very streamlined way.
And one of those easiest way to kind of manage all of these emails now, Manoj will take it up right from here.
I'll be right here and we'll assist you with the setup so that you can test it for a couple of more days, weeks and then we'll look into what management to test on basis of the use cases?
Thank you, Manoj over to you.
So, Ronan, let's get started with the trial.

Yeah, and in the meantime, I will check with my product team and see if anything else has to be done.
Apart from that, your account is ready and you can start testing.
Will the personal inboxes, will they come in here as well for each person?
If you connect them, yeah, right now, it's just a shared mailbox which is connected.
Excuse me, all new emails into your unassigned and, you know, on the right hand side, you have your activity panel where you make the assignment status tags.
Once you assign an email to yourself, it goes into your mind folder and rest of the team can see it in the team folder.
And when you click on all views right below tags… yeah, you have the pending and the closed section which relates to the status.
So we have three default status, open pending and closed.
The mine unassigned and the team section will have the open emails pending will have pending and the closed will have closed.
Now, you can create custom views based on assignment status and tags.
You see the small plus symbol right next to all views?
You have the filter option, use the filters to create your own custom view.
Like just go back from conversations?
Yeah, anything… tags, you see the tags option right below team.
So tags is ideally your folders.
Again, outlook, you might have folders categorizing the emails.
Similarly, you can have folders here, which will be visible to everybody in the team.
So you can just… use the folders to categorize the emails.

But in hiver, you have the way for automation like based on customer domains, a subject line, body of the email, any keywords, you pick it up, set up the automation to add the tag, and you can also use the automation to send… notification, assign to a person, add a tag update status and lots more.
And everything, every advanced setting is there under the admin panel?
So tags would be, I guess generally, they'd be like the type of email, like how it's dealt with sort of thing?
So how we normally use it is like for a sales use case, we have tags such as new customer, right?
And then we will have something based on invoices, and then something based on inquiries.
Yeah, all of these can be your tags, you know, because you might get several different sales issues or several sales feedback as well, right?
So all of these types of emails, you just list them down as tags.
So it's easier for you guys to track it.
So generally they would be manually assigned, but you can also create the automations.
So I would say that, you know, first you start manually assigning these tags so that, you know, for which emails these tags are going to be placed.
And from those emails, we can pick up those identificators.
Like is it the email address or is it a keyword from the subject?

Automatic, we do have an integration with helpscout.

yeah, select the inbox… save and enable… done.

But once you say, hey, we like hiver and we want to move forward with it, we can absolutely look at how many number of emails that we require.
And then we can sync all of those and put that into the closed bucket for you.
So that's called import process, which is absolutely doable.

I mean, where you log in right there on the top, you have our technical support available.
And then in case you want to self help yourself, this is a knowledge base.
So you can even go ahead and, you know, look at the help center, look at different automation workflow, and all of that.

Would, oh, actually, no, might be fine.
I can do slightly earlier if you want or.

I'm going to be inviting you and should you need to invite anybody else from your team after they're also invited to the test account and they've got more questions.

So we'll keep you posted about that one.

Hopefully that's the case, no worries.

Sometimes it does take maybe one or two extra minutes, but it should be right there.
Thank you so much again, and we look forward to talking to you next week.
Enjoy the rest of your day.
